types.description: Arithmetic addition operation with floats

in_ports.description: Thirty two ports for addition operation. Indexed from 0 to 31. Results are sent after at least one packet is received on each connected port.
in_ports.name: OPERAND[32]

types.name: float/addition

out_ports.description: Sum of values received on ports OPERAND[0] to OPERAND[31].
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Arithmetic division operation with floats

in_ports.description: Recieves dividend value.
in_ports.name: DIVIDEND

in_ports.description: Receives divisor value.
in_ports.name: DIVISOR

types.name: float/division

out_ports.description: Quotient from the division of DIVIDEND by DIVISOR.
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Arithmetic modulo operation with floats

in_ports.description: First port of modulo operation.
in_ports.name: DIVIDEND

in_ports.description: Second port of modulo operation.
in_ports.name: DIVISOR

types.name: float/modulo

out_ports.description: Remainder from the division of DIVIDEND by DIVISOR.
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Arithmetic multiplication operation with floats

in_ports.description: Thirty two ports for multiplication operation. Indexed from 0 to 31. Results are sent after at least one packet is received on each connect port.
in_ports.name: OPERAND[32]

types.name: float/multiplication

out_ports.description: Product of values received on ports OPERAND[0] to OPERAND[31].
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Arithmetic subtraction operation with floats

in_ports.description: Receives minuend value.
in_ports.name: MINUEND

in_ports.description: Receives subtrahend value.
in_ports.name: SUBTRAHEND

types.name: float/subtraction

out_ports.description: Difference of values received on ports MINUEND and SUBTRAHEND.
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Calculates absolute value of a number.

in_ports.description: Input number.
in_ports.name: IN

types.name: float/abs

out_ports.description: Number's absolute value.
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Constrain value to it's range

in_ports.description: Value to be constrained.
in_ports.name: IN

types.name: float/constrain

members.description: Range values (min, max, step). Used only if use_input_range is disabled.
members.name: range

members.description: Use min, max and step values from package instead of options min, max and step. It's useful if you need to convert from many different sources to the same range and all of them inform these values correctly in each package.
members.name: use_input_range

out_ports.description: Value constrained considering range
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Calculates the natural logarithm of an input value.

in_ports.description: Number to have natural logarithm calculated.
in_ports.name: IN

types.name: float/ln

out_ports.description: The result of the natural logarithm operation.
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Map values to different range

in_ports.description: Value to be converted.
in_ports.name: IN

types.name: float/map

members.description: Input's range. Used only if use_input_range is disabled.
members.name: input_range

members.description: Use min and max values from input package instead of option input_range. It's useful if you need to convert from many different sources to the same range and all of them inform these values correctly in each package.
members.name: use_input_range

out_ports.description: Value mapped considering input and output ranges
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Float Max

in_ports.description: Two ports for max operation. Indexed from 0 to 1.

out_ports.description: Maximum value between IN[0] and IN[1].

in_ports.description: Two ports for min operation. Indexed from 0 to 1.
in_ports.name: IN[2]

out_ports.description: Minimum value between IN[0] and IN[1].
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Check if an float is equal to other.

in_ports.description: Two ports for equal comparison operation. Indexed from 0 to 1.
in_ports.name: IN[2]

types.name: float/equal

out_ports.description: True if value received on port IN[0] is equal to value received on port IN[1].
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Check if an float is greater than or equal to other.

in_ports.description: Two ports for greater-or-equal comparison operation. Indexed from 0 to 1, and IN[0] being the left operand.

types.name: float/greater-or-equal

out_ports.description: True if value received on port IN[0] is greater than or equal to value received on port IN[1].
out_ports.name: OUT

in_ports.description: Two ports for greater comparison operation. Indexed from 0 to 1, and IN[0] being the left operand.
in_ports.name: IN[2]

types.name: float/greater

out_ports.description: True if value received on port IN[0] is greater than value received on port IN[1].
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Check if an float is less than or equal to other.

in_ports.description: Two ports for less-or-equal comparison operation. Indexed from 0 to 1, and IN[0] being the left operand.
in_ports.name: IN[2]

types.name: float/less-or-equal

out_ports.description: True if value received on port IN[0] is less than or equal to value received on port IN[1].
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Check if an float is less than other.

in_ports.description: Two ports for less comparison operation. Indexed from 0 to 1, and IN[0] being the left operand.
in_ports.name: IN[2]

types.name: float/less

out_ports.description: True if value received on port IN[0] is less than value received on port IN[1].
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Check if an float is different from other.

in_ports.description: Two ports for not-equal comparison operation. Indexed from 0 to 1
in_ports.name: IN[2]

types.name: float/not-equal

out_ports.description: True if value received on port IN[0] is different from value received on port IN[1].
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Filter floats in range
types.name: float/filter

in_ports.description: Data input port.
in_ports.name: IN

out_ports.description: Outputs the same variable as the input if it's in range, nothing otherwise.
out_ports.name: OUT

members.description: if true, the packet irange will have it's min and max changed to the min and max of this node.
members.name: range_override

types.description: A waves generator node that, after each input tick, generates the next value of its defined function on its output port. That function is defined by the various options members it's got, and has the form that goes from a minimum to an maximum value. When at those two extreme values, it may hold (for a pulse or more) on them, before resuming the increment/decrement steps. Thus, it is capable of producing trapezoidal/triangular/sawtooth/square waves. This node won't send any initial packets after port connections are made on its output port solely -- it needs an explicit 'pulse' on its input port to produce packets.

in_ports.description: Iterate to next generator's function value, outputting a packet.
in_ports.name: TICK

types.name: float/wave-generator-trapezoidal

members.description: In how many function iterations (ticks) it should go from max to min values. The value must be greater than or equal to 1 (which means go from max to min instantly). With this value, the node will calculate the 'increasing step' of the function for you.
members.name: ticks_inc

members.description: The maximum value of the wave. This must be greater than min.
members.name: max

members.description: In how many function iterations (ticks) it should go from min to max values. The value must be greater than or equal to 1 (which means go from min to max instantly). With this value, the node will calculate the 'increasing step' of the function for you.
members.name: ticks_dec

members.description: The minimum value of the wave. This must be less than max.
members.name: min

members.description: The starting point of the wave, in ticks (must be greater or equal to 0). Zero means to start at min value, when no ticks have happened yet. Use this to shift the starting point and overwrite the default behavior.
members.name: tick_start

members.description: The number of (extra) input ticks the wave will hold its output at max value when it reaches it. The value must be greater than or equal to 0.
members.name: ticks_at_max

members.description: The number of (extra) input ticks the wave will hold its output at min value when it reaches it. The value must be greater than or equal to 0.
members.name: ticks_at_min

out_ports.description: The generator's current function value. This port won't send any initial packets after a connection is made. The node expects an explicit 'pulse' on its input port to produce packets.
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: A node that, after each input tick, generates the next value of the sine function on its output port. With fine tuning of it tick_start option, the cosine function can be achieved as well. A multiplier value can be supplied for the original [-1.0, 1.0] range, too. This node won't send any initial packets after port connections are made on its output port solely -- it needs an explicit 'pulse' on its input port to produce packets.

in_ports.description: Iterate to next generator's function value, outputting a packet.
in_ports.name: TICK

types.name: float/wave-generator-sinusoidal

members.description: In how many function iterations (ticks) it should go from the starting to the ending value of each function period (AKA function's resolution). The value must be greater than or equal to 1 (which means go from start to end in one step only), but note that waves very small values for this option tend to be useless.
members.name: ticks_per_period

members.description: The sine wave's amplitude. This must be a positive number, which will multiply the values in the pristine [-1.0, 1.0] range.
members.name: amplitude

members.description: The starting point of the wave, in ticks (must be greater or equal to 0). Zero means to start at the beginning of the sive wave, when no ticks have happened yet. Use this to shift the starting point and overwrite the default behavior.
members.name: tick_start

out_ports.description: The generator's current function value. This port won't send any initial packets after a connection is made. The node expects an explicit 'pulse' on its input port to produce packets.
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Classifies input float according to one of float classifications: Not a Number, Infinite, Zero, Subnormal or Normal. It has OUT ports for each classification and sends input float to its classification OUT port.

in_ports.description: Float to be classified.
in_ports.name: IN

types.name: float/classify

out_ports.description: If input is NaN, it will go through this port.
out_ports.name: NAN

out_ports.description: If input is Infinite (either positive or negative), it will go through this port.
out_ports.name: INFINITE

out_ports.description: If input is Zero, it will go through this port.
out_ports.name: ZERO

out_ports.description: If input is Subnormal, it will go through this port.
out_ports.name: SUBNORMAL

out_ports.description: If input is Normal, it will go through this port.
out_ports.name: NORMAL
